comments: It is well-known and easy to prove (see Honsbeger) that a(n) > 0 for n > 1, [_N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 05 2009]Terms are pairwise coprime with very high probability. I didn't find terms which are pairwise noncoprime, although it may be a case of the "strong law of small numbers." - [Daniel Forgues, Apr 23 2012]
references: R. Honsberger, Mathematical Diamonds, MAA, 2003, see p. 79. [Added by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 05 2009]
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=0,...,100
prog: (PARI) { n=-1; m=1; forprime (p=2, prime(101), write("b060882.txt", n++, " ", m - p); m*=p; ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 13 2009]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 05 2001
